    • Method Detail

      • getSort

        public java.util.List<T> getSort()
                          throws GraphError
        Description copied from interface: TopologicalSort
        Do a topological sort on this graph, if it is acyclic. A topological sort is a listing of the nodes in the (acyclic) graph such that if there is a path in the graph from node A to node B then node A will appear before node B in the listing.
        Specified by:
        getSort in interface TopologicalSort<T>
        Returns:
        A list of type T which is in a topological sort
        Throws:
        GraphError - A type of error made for the graph used by the topological sort

      • getNextNode

        private T getNextNode(java.util.Set<T> set)
        Parameters:
        set - a set of the nodes used by the graph
        Returns:
        the next node to be used by the topological sort, found by getting the next node which is not already in the return list and has a reference count of 0
